page.title: 17Mr.Bell-Memories of an OAP 1
page.content: Mr.Bell is a local OAP who has collected almost 2000 slides / phptographs of the area as it used to be. In 1935 King George V was celebrating his Silver Jubilee.At that time Mr.Bell worked at the N.E.Engineering Works as an engine fitter.His father and two brothers also worked there.He worked from 07.30 until 17.00 and on Saturdays from 07.30 to 12.00.The works is closed now and the building is used as a warehouse. Mr.Bell lived in terraced house with an outdoor toilet but no bathroom.In his leisute time he saw black & white 'talkies' at the local cinema.He went swimming at Hendon Beach and enjoyed a drink at the local pub.He went to church three times on Sunday. {CONT on page 18 }
